definitions.definition: Tending to ask questions, or to want to explore or investigate; inquisitive; (with a negative connotation) nosy, prying.
definitions.example: Young children are naturally curious about the world and everything in it.

definitions.definition: Leading one to ask questions about; somewhat odd, out of the ordinary, or unusual.
definitions.example: The platypus is a curious creature, with fur like a mammal and a beak like a bird.

definitions.definition: Careful, fastidious, particular; (specifically) demanding a high standard of excellence, difficult to satisfy.
Carefully or artfully constructed; made with great elegance or skill.
